page.title: 01THE VILLAGE OF DOUNE
page.content: The Village of Doune lies in a lovely setting of hills and rivers in Central Scotland. The area is mainly rural with 2 main estates, Argaty and Moray. Doune is dominated by the{ {castle}built in 1370 by Robert Duke of Albany and restored in 1883-86. Beautifully maintained with several rooms still in use today it was handed over to the Ancient Monument Department in 1984. Fishermen find the nearby fast flowing{River Teith} excellent for salmon and brown trout. Doune has many interesting features; a village cross dating from early trading days, some{standing stones} where the drovers' trails met and several old churches and houses. Today there is a new housing estate on the outskirts of the village, but Main Street still retains its{old world {village character.
